Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for data storage, including capacity, scalability, and performance needs. Identify the types of data to be stored and access patterns.
Design the storage architecture, including folder structure, naming conventions, and access control policies. Plan for integration with other Azure services.

Tasks.Task: Create Azure Data Lake Storage Account
Tasks.Task Description: Provision a new Azure Data Lake Storage account in the Azure portal. Select the appropriate performance tier and redundancy options.
Set up role-based access control (RBAC) and Azure Active Directory (AAD) integration to manage permissions for users and applications.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure advanced security features such as private endpoints and firewalls.
Configure Azure Monitor and Storage Analytics to track performance, usage, and security metrics. Set up alerts for critical events.
Perform tests to validate storage performance, access control, and integration with other Azure services. Ensure the setup meets the defined requirements.
Create detailed documentation of the storage architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Data Lake Storage.
Set up a backup and recovery plan to ensure data resiliency. Test the plan to verify its effectiveness.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with security and operational standards. Review access logs and storage usage periodically.
